methods.name: files.comments.delete
methods.description: Deletes an existing comment on a file.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: file
params.description: File to delete a comment from.

params.name: id
params.description: The comment to delete.

errors.name: file_not_found
errors.description: The requested file could not be found.

errors.name: file_deleted
errors.description: The requested file was previously deleted.

errors.name: cant_delete
errors.description: The requested comment could not be deleted.

errors.name: comment_not_found [hidden]
errors.description: The requested comment could not be found

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

errors.name: account_inactive
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace when using a bot token.

errors.name: token_revoked
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace or the app has been removed when using a user token.

errors.name: no_permission
errors.description: The workspace token used in this request does not have the permissions necessary to complete the request. Make sure your app is a member of the conversation it's attempting to post a message to.

errors.name: org_login_required
errors.description: The workspace is undergoing an enterprise migration and will not be available until migration is complete.

errors.name: ekm_access_denied
errors.description: Administrators have suspended the ability to post a message.

errors.name: missing_scope
errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific scope permissions required to complete this request.

errors.name: not_allowed_token_type
errors.description: The token type used in this request is not allowed.

errors.name: method_deprecated
errors.description: The method has been deprecated.

errors.name: deprecated_endpoint
errors.description: The endpoint has been deprecated.

errors.name: two_factor_setup_required
errors.description: Two factor setup is required.

errors.name: enterprise_is_restricted
errors.description: The method cannot be called from an Enterprise.

errors.name: invalid_arguments
errors.description: The method was either called with invalid arguments or some detail about the arguments passed are invalid, which is more likely when using complex arguments like blocks or attachments.

errors.name: invalid_arg_name
errors.description: The method was passed an argument whose name falls outside the bounds of accepted or expected values. This includes very long names and names with non-alphanumeric characters other than _. If you get this error, it is typically an indication that you have made a very malformed API call.

errors.name: invalid_array_arg
errors.description: The method was passed an array as an argument. Please only input valid strings.

errors.name: invalid_charset
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request, but the charset specified in the Content-Type header was invalid. Valid charset names are: utf-8 iso-8859-1.

errors.name: invalid_form_data
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request with Content-Type application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data, but the form data was either missing or syntactically invalid.

errors.name: invalid_post_type
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request, but the specified Content-Type was invalid. Valid types are: application/json application/x-www-form-urlencoded multipart/form-data text/plain.

errors.name: missing_post_type
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request and included a data payload, but the request did not include a Content-Type header.

errors.description: The workspace associated with your request is currently undergoing migration to an Enterprise Organization. Web API and other platform operations will be intermittently unavailable until the transition is complete.

errors.name: invalid_json [hidden]
errors.description: The method was called via a `POST` request with `Content-Type` `application/json`, but the body was not valid JSON.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: file
params.description: Specify a file by providing its ID.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of items to return per page.Default: 100

params.name: cursor
params.description: Parameter for pagination. File comments are paginated for a single file. Set cursor equal to the next_cursor attribute returned by the previous request's response_metadata. This parameter is optional, but pagination is mandatory: the default value simply fetches the first "page" of the collection of comments. See pagination for more details.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the list hasn't been reached.Default: 0

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of results to return.Default: 1

methods.name: files.list
methods.description: List for a team, in a channel, or from a user with applied filters.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Filter files appearing in a specific channel, indicated by its ID.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of items to return per page.Default: 100

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of results to return.Default: 1

params.name: show_files_hidden_by_limit
params.description: Show truncated file info for files hidden due to being too old, and the team who owns the file being over the file limit.

params.name: team_id
params.description: encoded team id to list files in, required if org token is used

params.name: ts_from
params.description: Filter files created after this timestamp (inclusive).Default: 0

params.name: ts_to
params.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive).Default: now

params.name: types
params.description: Filter files by type (see below). You can pass multiple values in the types argument, like types=spaces,snippets.The default value is all, which does not filter the list.Default: all

params.name: user
params.description: Filter files created by a single user.

errors.name: user_not_found
errors.description: Value passed for user was invalid

errors.name: unknown_type
errors.description: Value passed for types was invalid

errors.name: missing_argument
errors.description: A required argument is missing.

errors.description: user removed from team (generated)

methods.description: Enables a file for public/external sharing.

params.name: file
params.description: File to share

errors.description: Value passed for file was invalid

errors.description: Public sharing has been disabled for this team

errors.description: Public sharing of videos is not available. A Free instance of Slack may encounter this error because free teams don't have the ability to share video files publicly.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channels
params.description: Comma-separated list of channel names or IDs where the file will be shared.

params.name: content
params.description: File contents via a POST variable. If omitting this parameter, you must provide a file.

params.name: file
params.description: File contents via multipart/form-data. If omitting this parameter, you must submit content.

params.name: filename
params.description: Filename of file.

params.name: filetype
params.description: A file type identifier.

params.name: initial_comment
params.description: The message text introducing the file in specified channels.

params.name: thread_ts
params.description: Provide another message's ts value to upload this file as a reply. Never use a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

params.name: title
params.description: Title of file.

errors.name: posting_to_general_channel_denied
errors.description: An admin has restricted posting to the #general channel.

errors.name: invalid_channel
errors.description: One or more channels supplied are invalid

errors.name: file_uploads_disabled [hidden]
errors.description: Team Owner has requested that no users can upload files on this team.

errors.name: file_uploads_except_images_disabled [hidden]
errors.description: Team Owner has requested that only image files, but nothing else, can be uploaded on this team.

errors.name: file_upload_size_restricted [hidden]
errors.description: Team admin has set max limit on file size for uploaded files

errors.name: no_file [hidden]
errors.description: No file or filename was included.

errors.name: storage_limit_reached [hidden]
errors.description: Team is out of file storage space.

errors.name: not_in_channel
errors.description: Authenticated user is not in the channel.

errors.description: At least one of the values passed for channels was invalid.

errors.description: upload error (generated)

errors.description: posting to channel denied (generated)

errors.name: slack_connect_blocked_file_type
errors.description: File uploads with certain types are blocked in all Slack Connect communications

errors.name: malware_detected

methods.name: files.remote.list
methods.description: Retrieve information about a remote file added to Slack

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Filter files appearing in a specific channel, indicated by its ID.

params.name: cursor
params.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See pagination for more detail.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of items to return.

params.name: ts_from
params.description: Filter files created after this timestamp (inclusive).Default: 0

params.name: ts_to
params.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive).Default: now

methods.name: files.remote.share
methods.description: Share a remote file into a channel.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channels
params.description: Comma-separated list of channel IDs where the file will be shared.

params.name: external_id
params.description: The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the file, as set by the app registering the file with Slack.  Either this field or file or both are required.

params.name: file
params.description: Specify a file registered with Slack by providing its ID. Either this field or external_id or both are required.

errors.name: not_in_channel
errors.description: Authenticated user is not in at least one of the the provided channels.

errors.name: file_not_found
errors.description: No file with the requested ID found.

errors.name: channel_not_found
errors.description: At least one of the values passed for channels was invalid.

errors.name: invalid_args
errors.description: Invalid arguments passed to endpoint

errors.name: no_bot_user_for_app
errors.description: Cannot call the Remote Files endpoints unless app has associated bot user

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

errors.name: account_inactive
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace when using a bot token.

errors.name: token_revoked
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace or the app has been removed when using a user token.

errors.name: no_permission
errors.description: The workspace token used in this request does not have the permissions necessary to complete the request. Make sure your app is a member of the conversation it's attempting to post a message to.

errors.name: org_login_required
errors.description: The workspace is undergoing an enterprise migration and will not be available until migration is complete.

errors.name: ekm_access_denied
errors.description: Administrators have suspended the ability to post a message.

errors.name: missing_scope
errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific scope permissions required to complete this request.

errors.name: not_allowed_token_type
errors.description: The token type used in this request is not allowed.

errors.name: method_deprecated
errors.description: The method has been deprecated.

errors.name: deprecated_endpoint
errors.description: The endpoint has been deprecated.

errors.name: two_factor_setup_required
errors.description: Two factor setup is required.

errors.name: enterprise_is_restricted
errors.description: The method cannot be called from an Enterprise.

errors.name: team_access_not_granted
errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific workspace access required to complete this request.

errors.name: invalid_arguments
errors.description: The method was either called with invalid arguments or some detail about the arguments passed are invalid, which is more likely when using complex arguments like blocks or attachments.

errors.name: invalid_arg_name
errors.description: The method was passed an argument whose name falls outside the bounds of accepted or expected values. This includes very long names and names with non-alphanumeric characters other than _. If you get this error, it is typically an indication that you have made a very malformed API call.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: external_id
params.description: Creator defined GUID for the file.

params.name: external_url
params.description: URL of the remote file.

params.name: file
params.description: Specify a file by providing its ID.

params.name: filetype
params.description: type of file

params.name: indexable_file_contents
params.description: File containing contents that can be used to improve searchability for the remote file.

params.name: preview_image
params.description: Preview of the document via multipart/form-data.

params.name: title
params.description: Title of the file being shared.

errors.name: bad_image
errors.description: The uploaded image could not be processed - try passing a JPG or PNG

errors.name: too_large
errors.description: The uploaded image had excessive dimensions

errors.name: failed_to_unshare
errors.description: The file was either not found or it has been unshared already.

errors.name: file_not_found
errors.description: Could not find the file to update.

errors.name: file_editing_disabled [hidden]
